comment: Professor Chiang is a passionate and inspiring teacher. His tests are challenging, but you are sure to learn the content. He is great at lecturing. He interacts with his students and is always sure to explain things in a clear way. He is accessible outside of class and cares about his students.

Whoever said he cancelled class 8 times is lying. At most it was 5, and he made sure to accommodate his students for the inconvenience. Tests are hard, it's anatomy. You need to start studying a week ahead. He gives extra credit. Difficult class with a professor who tried to make it easier for us.

Chiang is a pretty good professor. He did cancel a few classes this semester and showed up late a couple times but never failed to accommodate his students. Although he does explain things well, get ready to study your ass off because just like any other A&P this class is not easy.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Great guy. Bad professor. Very unprofessional, cancelled at least 8 classes and stays MIA. probably still the best professor you could take for A&P though
rating_tags: TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Hard no.

Chiang is a good professor to have for a class that is this difficult. There's a TON of info that you need to know; his tests are specific and long. STUDY EVERY SINGLE DAY. If you don't you will fail every single test. He cancels class a lot and is bad at communicating with students. Read the textbooks and memorize powerpoints. Again; STUDY A LOT.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--TEST HEAVY--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: can't stress this enough.. STUDY EARLY. read the book and powerpoints and you will be straight! So many people studied the night before and failed. Chiang is an excellent professor and explains material so well. :)

Heard so many things about anatomy and how people fail so much. Then i took it and here's the deal. Majority of people who failed skipped class, left early, were on phones during lecture, didnt pay attention in class or straight up didnt care! Also majority of the class were nursing students so i guess they are not used to a hard course. STUDY!!!!

GREAT PROFESSOR!! anatomy is hard but if you take time and study, you will do great. DO NOT STUDY THE NIGHT BEFORE YOU WILL BE SCREWED. His powerpoints are great and detailed, so study them, do objectives and read the book! He offers extra credit questions. I was super close to getting an A with those steps!

Chiang offers extra credit opportunities, study objectives, review sessions, and is always willing to help and answer any questions. He gives out his phone number you can ask him questions at any time. Anatomy is a tough subject but he makes it so much better. One of the professors Ive ever had at KSU.

He teaches in a way as if you already knew the basics of the material already. He is trying to help, but he is kinda condescending when answering questions. He canceled classes randomly and was late a lot so be prepared for that if you register him.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: He is my favorite professor!!!!!! TAKE HIM!!!!

You WANT Chiang! Anatomy is a lot & will be hard regardless of who you take. He really cares for his students & tells you exactly what you need to know to get an A. Gives a lot of extra credit & his tests are his powerpoints exactly so memorize everything. He'll cancel class a lot or be late so be prepared for that. He even lets you text him! TAKE!

No matter who you take A&P WILL be difficult. Chiang is the best professor both inside and out. He actually cares about your success and gives multiple opportunities to enhance you grade if you put in the work. He takes time out of his weekends to review material and answers questions that you need. TAKE HIM. YOU WONT REGRET IT.

He is my favorite professor. I took him for 1 & 2. A&P isn't an easy coarse in general, and he does everything he can to make the experience better. He holds many review sessions, gives extra credit quizzes, worksheets, and online resources. You have to study, but read the book and study power points and there is no reason to not do well.

Chiang is definitely my favorite professor at Kennesaw!!! He wants his students to succeed so he gives out his number, holds many out of class study reviews, and gives out extra credit quizzes. His tests are hard, but anatomy is a hard class in general. Study his power points and read the book because his tests come straight from there.

He has SO many reviews. Chiang is awesome!! I took him for 1 and 2. Unfortunately, I did not for lab. He does extra study sessions and is accessible. Took him after Nowak. His tests arent easy but hers were confusing and really hard. I didn not understand blood typing Nowaks lecture or in lab, but his worksheet made it all click 100% cute

I love Chiang! Took him for A&P 1 & 2. Class material is hard (obviously) but he makes every effort to boost your grade! Offers extra credit quizzes, willing to meet up on weekends and after class, very kind and realistic. He goes out of his way to get you where you need to be. Tests based directly off notes (application based). 100% recommend.

Really nice guy and knows his stuff. He does give out his number so he's easy to reach. Don't get me wrong the class is tough but it's AP. His exams are defineitly doable but you gotta study. MC diagrams and t/f. Extra helpful, one of the best professors I've had. Made As, but you have to read, some test Q is from textbook. Take him for both 1 & 2!
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: He teaches the material as if you should already know the basics.  A lot of the students going into certain programs have never done a science.  His entire lecture was just very confusing to me.  He used the projector as well as writing randomly all over the board.  It was really not helpful and I ended up changing professors.

Chiang is by far the best professor I have ever had.  He will help you whenever needed and gives out his phone number so you can contact him whenever needed.  If you do the learning objectives and go to class it will be a breeze.  I HIGHLY recommend taking him for both the lecture and the lab.  Tests are rough, but not impossible by any means.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Super nice guy. Really knows what he's talking about. Gives you everything you need to succeed. Do the objectives and you'll do well on tests. Gives extra credit quizzes the class before each test, and posts which diagrams will be on tests. Anatomy is difficult, but he simplifies it. Really cares about his students too! 10/10 recommend
WHOA. I was the last review, did NOT mean to give him a bad score. Going to level it out with this score. Take him.
rating_tags: BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: I took Chiang last semester & he was kinda condescending, but he's REALLY helpful. He's available via TEXT which means he's a fast replier.  He's very young & lets you know EXACTLY what you DON'T need to know, which is helpful. SOMETIMES gives extra credit. I think he's just condescending because smart people lack that "No don't be rude" button lol
rating_tags: Get ready to read--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Took A&P 1 over after having Nowak. Her tests were ridiculously difficult compared to Chiang's. So in my opinion, his were easy. Just study the material. It is fast-paced and can be difficult, but that isn't his fault. PLEASE go to SI sessions, they are there for a reason. It is possible to make an A. Just stay on top of things, you can do it!!!!

Chiang is great! If you find yourself struggling, review the material more and ASK HIM if you are still confused. SI helps to see possible questions and get in a test-taking mindset. Chiang and the SI are always willing to help you understand. Our class got SO MANY extra credit opportunities in quizzes, plus each exam is out of a possible 105%.
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria--TEST HEAVY

comment: Professor Chiang is awesome. He grades you on 4 online quizzes and 4 tests. The quizzes are 10% of your grade and the tests are 90%. He gives out plenty of extra credit through quizzes in class, but you have to go to class to know about them. If you need help with anything, he's always willing to do so.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Chiang was my favorite professor. His class is very hard, but if you work for it you will get the grade you want. He gives extra credit opportunities often and has online quizzes. Tests are very hard, but it's anatomy so he can't really control that.
rating_tags: BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--TEST HEAVY--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Do y'all see all of these reviews? Anatomy is one of those subjects that require you to put in the work.  The material isn't all THAT hard, there is just a lot of material.  READ THE TEXTBOOK.  I only went to his class 5 times, for 3 exams, 1 final, and a lecture for extra credit.  Made a 95 in the class.  Just have to study and put in the time.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Without a doubt one of the best professors at KSU. Very accessible and willing to set up times to meet with you so that you can go over the tests and know the material. Encourages you and his lectures actually help you understand the content PLUS he has a great sense of humor.

Chiang has been one of my favorite professors so far.  He is organized and clear about expectations for the class.  He reviews content quickly, but everything he goes over will match the textbook and PowerPoint slides; and ultimately the tests.  Know details about the material-- lots of True/False questions. Announced extra credit quizzes.
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Professor Chiang is honestly one of the best science professors I have ever taken.  He doesn't just read off the powerpoints, but explains things to you.  If you go to his office hours, he will do his best to make sure you leave understanding the material.  He gives announced extra credit quizzes too.  Hard material, but he makes an A realistic.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Attendance isn't mandatory, but you'll have to study a whole lot more if you don't go to class. He talks pretty fast and is kind of all over the place sometimes. 3 tests and cumulative final, also has extra credit in-class quizzes. Always answers questions, even gave out his cell #. I took him for lecture and lab! He's awesome. Would take him again
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: I took him for lecture and Lab. Both were super difficult. He does as much as he can, however, you really have to learn to teach yourself in this class.

The rumors are true, this class is very difficult. However, Chiang is a great professor and is very willing to help. SI sessions are  available. Tests can be passed by only going over your notes, however, the notes are very long and extensive. Exams are very difficult, but he gives quizzes which points can be added to your exam.

He was really nice and explains things multiple times. He doesn't try to confuse you, but the tests are hard and sometimes the material isn't really covered.  He was easy to listen to and sometimes made jokes. I would recommend him if you don't want too think too hard in class and want to be kinda engaged in lectures. But good luck on long tests!
Literally one of the best anatomy professors at Kennesaw. The class is hard, but he will be your best bet of passing well.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Hilarious

comment: Rich is great at what he does. I recommend him to everyone who asks and wish I could've gotten him for bio 2222. This class is not easy, it is lecture heavy with a ton of content to learn but it is possible to succeed. As a professor he is extremely dependable and extremely helpful. I had him for lecture & lab.

Professor Chiang was great! His lectures can be a bit boring at times if you're not super passionate about Anatomy, but he goes above and beyond to help you outside of class, in case you're confused about anything. He'll even give you his number, so you can text/call him if you have any questions/doubts. Tests challenge you to think, so study! :)

Anatomy 2 is definitely a hard class material wise but Chiang made it possible to pass. Three tests, a final, and a couple of quizzes. He gave a lot of extra credit which really helped to keep your grade up! His lectures can be a little confusing because he skips around a lot so it can be hard to follows at times but he posts his powerpoints on D2L

ANATOMY IS HARD. There is only so much he can do for you, you have to study outside of class a lot. My advice is to read the chapter before the lecture, print off the PP from D2l & make notes on that. Then rewrite your notes and make flashcards. His tests are scary: Half multiple choice, 25% labeling, 25% T/F. D2L quizzes are a grade saver.

Prof. Chiang is absolutely amazing. This course is HARD, but he tries his best to help. He gives out his phone number and will always take appointments to help students. Gives objectives that are extremely clear. Very detailed power points. Would take again.

I took him for both lecture and lab, received an A in both. He really helped me and worked with me on a personal level. His powerpoints are very detailed, I didn't even use my book all semester. I wish I took him for A&P 1. This class is not an easy A, but if you show him you're actually trying, he'll meet you halfway.

Chiang is simply the best professor I have ever had. I struggled early on the semester but I talked to him and went to his office hours for help and it helped greatly. Chiang makes the class very interesting and has a sense of humor. Chiang is amazing and I HIGHLY recommend you take him for this class. Make sure you go to class though!

Took Chiang for a&p 2, he's a good guy. very helpful outside of class. he can answer most questions asked in class. his powerpoint have lot info, but they are clear. he covers the material in more detail than other professors but i learned a lot. even learned how to study. this was my first real challenging class, should have taken him for a&p 1

Read the book before you show up to class and you will be fine.  No matter who you take, this class is hard.  It's a lot of material and a lot of work, but Chiang is happy to help.  He always answers emails, even gives out his cell so you can text him.  He gives you study objectives, so if you work through those before test time you can get an A.
I wouldn't recommend him at all

Richard is an awesome professor. He is always willing to further explain any concepts you may have missed &  goes a step further by being available by cell. The reason I gave a 3 for easiness is because of the material. STUDY! He does use an extensive vocabulary but it's because he won't water down the material, that would be a disservice to you.

Very tough class. Chiang is a great guy, very funny. However, he is super confusing and uses language that is confusing for students. You NEED the book to clarify the subject. Chiang is so incredibly smart, but its very easy to get lost in this subject with his vocabulary. Prepare to study A LOT.

Chiang is hilarious and genuiniely wants his students to succeed. However, he is EXTREMELY hard to understand. He approaches lectures with language that he expects you to understand when you haven't learned the topic yet. I learn much more from the book (much more clear than he is). Good guy, tough tests, hard to understand.

He's very passionate about the material but explains it in a similar way only a PHD grad would understand.  His lectures have left me more confused than the textbook. He does want you to succeed and is available for extra help it's just that his style of teaching is difficult to understand unless you are already in the field.

I have only been to a few lectures and one lab. Chiang seems very casual. He doesn't want you to call him Mr. Chiang, so right off that bat  he was approachable. He speaks fast in lecture no doubt, but it seems there is a lot of material. He's already been very helpful outside of class. I hope this will be a good semester. Will update later

I had Chiang for Anatomy 1 and Anatomy 1 lab and he is awesome. The material itself is really difficult so do not expect an easy A. You really have to study and try but Chiang really wants to help. His lectures can be a little fast paced and because he's extremely intelligent. Would take again for sure.

He is a new teacher so he is strict. He doesn't do extra credit. He barely does quizzes but when he does it is D2L and the quizzes are everything that was covered in the book. Hard teacher and Hard class. do no take him, TRUST ME

Chiang was awesome. I'm taking him again for A&P 2. His class is hard, but it's anatomy so of course it's hard. Chiang will spend hours with you in his office helping you learn. He can be a little intimidating at first because he is literally so smart, but he really does want to help you.

I took Chiang for lab and  lecture. Definitely recommend him for lab. Not so much for  Lecture. He is very smart knows EVERYTHING . Two exams in lab  &  four exams in lecture. His Lectures are confusing and hard to follow he moves very fast and the test are HARD but for lab he is the best. Would definitely take him for AP2 lab.

Chiang is really smart and definitely knows the material. All of his tests come from the power points and learning objectives, but make sure you know it backwards and forwards, because his test questions are SAT style and can be tricky. Overall, good professor and awesome class, but DO NOT underestimate how much you need to study. Got an A+

I did not get the grade I wanted, but that was because i didn't put in the time like I should have. Chiang definitely knows his stuff, and is enthusiastic when it comes to both lab and lecture. His powerpoints are helpful, the exams are detailed but thats because its physio. Highly recommend. I'll be taking him again.

He could stand to work on speaking up & having some enthusiasm. He tends to just drone on reading the ppt. word for word. You need to have basically all material down pat b/c tests are DETAILED & have tricky true/false & every multiple choice ends with D)some/all of these are correct E)none are correct, so not a lot of room for successful guessing.

i had him for lab and lecture. he is enthusiastic and knows he knows the material well. he has four exams, the final is cumulative in lecture. You have two exams in lab. I have nothing really negative to say about him. he means well, and knows his stuff

I had Chiang for lab, he is very caring and wants success for all of his students. He is very hands off in lab, goes over what you need to learn in the beginning and then you're on your own. He jokes a lot and is always willing to help if you have questions, he allows you go attend any of his labs throughout the week. He knows his stuff, genius.

I took him for A&P 1 lab and received an A. The material itself is extremely difficult. He was always very helpful when I asked, but is pretty hands off in the lab setting. Personally I liked that as it allowed me to best use lab time for the models and concepts that were hardest rather than having the entire class doing the same thing.

There is no "easy" A&P class so if you're looking for that you might want to change your major. Chiang is very specific as to what is important for tests. He's really there to help you out. He knows there's a lot to learn and will meet up with you whenever to help. I really recommend taking him because not all A&P professors will do this.

Everything you need to do well is given and that is a plus. Sometimes his in class examples can be confusing, but his 1 on 1 help is great. He seems to genuinely care about students success. tends to joke around. Class also came with a SI Leader named Dylan who sat down with me for five hours until I knew everything. Difficult but cant complain.

great teach, very smart, posts ppts. three tests and a final, each one has around 100 questions plus a few bonus questions. keep up with the class for sure. gives his number so students can call him and ask questions. seems genuine & wants the best out of you. take him for lab, very helpful & committed, always running around answering questions

This teacher knows his stuff. Very enthusiastic. It's A&P, so I expected the class to demanding, and it definitely was. His powerpoints were clear and concise, and he posts objectives posted for each test. Talks fast, but that's because there is a lot of material. Tests are commanding. You definitely work for your grade. Funny. Recommended.

This professor is very smart and knows the material well, he is just a poor teacher as a whole. I needed someone to actually teach me the material, but he simply skims through it in class and is sort of difficult to listen to. His tests are very detailed but they all  pull from the pwrpnts and objectives.  It is A LOT of stuff to remember though!

Tough Class. The guy is extremely knowledgeable in the subject. Makes a great effort to be there for students. Down to earth guy. Tells you exactly what you need to know. Also has a SI Leader that can simplify tough concepts for you. Provides everything you need to be successful even if you can't follow along in lecture. Stay ahead in this class.

NEVER AGAIN. Chiang is intelligent beyond his means. He tests over random material and reads directly off of the slides in class. Everything that is actually essential and important is put on the back burner so that he can test over obscure topics. I have never been more frustrated in my life. Over 70% of the class dropped after the second test.

Attendance not mandatory, but a part of your grade. Chiang is very new and recently graduated college himself. He's one of those professors that is very knowledgeable about the subject he teaches, but cannot speak it into words. Anatomy is a very tough subject but I can handle the lecture, just not the lab with this guy. I dropped lab.
